title: Prepare Your Soil
description: Irish soil tends to be acidic. Add lime in winter to balance pH levels for spring planting.

title: Drainage is Key
description: Clonakilty's rainfall requires raised beds or adding grit to soil for better drainage.

title: Wind Protection
description: Use hedges or windbreaks to protect plants from Atlantic winds.

title: Spring Planting
description: Wait until late April to plant tender vegetables after last frosts.

title: Summer Maintenance
description: Water in early morning to reduce evaporation and prevent mildew.

title: Autumn Harvest
description: Harvest root vegetables before heavy autumn rains saturate the ground.
